It's v snappy

<@U02613K0X> <@U02HAJ6JF> curious if you have any insight on this. we’re seeing a lot of references to a host i don’t recognize, <http://galapagui.uncorkedstudios.com|galapagui.uncorkedstudios.com> it appears to be related to blog post content, but i can’t seem to track it down anywhere in the code
for example in the heroku logs: ```method=GET path="/blog/produce-row-map-console" host=<http://galapagui.uncorkedstudios.com|galapagui.uncorkedstudios.com>```
some are successful, others throwing 500s others timing out
that was the old staging site predating Hercules. Where are these requests being made?
it’s all coming from production hercules-client
there’s a number of other server references that appear to be deprecated as well
and i can’t seem to track down where they originate from
So we don’t know what part of the code makes these requests?
it’s calls being made to load blog content that appear to have old references in them
i don’t know where in the code they are originating from
i have tried looking through mongo but it’s a bit tough to search through the document structure
and i didn’t have much luck either
i don’t see those servers referenced just doing a quick find all
so i don’t know where else i would look
any thoughts?
I have no clue <@U02HAJ6JF> is this ringing any bells?
sounds familiar, but that’s about it.
